c74object.name: j.namespace
c74object.description: j.namespace is a utility to perform advanced Jamoma namespace queries and filtering. It is useful to manage and navigate through the various nodes addresses of your Jamoma Max patch, for example when building dynamic GUI interface

outlet.description: j.namespace leftmost outlet outputs the nodes addresses matching the filter appied on the namespace selection. Addresses may be output as a single list or as preformatted messages for some Max GUI objects, as defined by the format attribute
j.namespace middle outlet outputs the size of the filter result that is, the number of matching nodes addresses
Dump out values of the various j.namespace attributes

objarg.name: name
objarg.description: Optional argument sets a name for this namespace selection so it can be referenced from other Jamoma object (ie. j.cue)

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang at j.namespace leftmost inlet triggers namespace filtering

method.name: anything
method.description: A symbol at j.namespace inlet triggers namespace filtering from the specified address (sets the address attribute and trigger filtering)

method.name: dump
method.description: The dump message outputs j.namespace attributes value at it rightmost outlet

method.name: filter/info
method.description: The filter/info message followed by a filter name (symbol) outputs the filter pattern out of j.namespace rightmost outlet

method.name: filter/remove
method.description: The filter/remove message followed by a filter name (symbol) remove the filter pattern from the list of active filters

method.name: explore
method.description: The explore message triggers namespace filtering

method.name: filter/set
method.description:
The filter/set message followed by a list of item and value pairs set criteria used to filter the namespace. Available items and values are:
object (object_type): the type of object to apply filter to. Available values are:
Container (a model or a view)
Data (a parameter, message or return)
Viewer (any j.remote)
none (any empty node)
ie. 'object Data'
attribute (attribute_name): the name of the object attribute to test. This can be any of the Jamoma external attributes. ie. 'attribute dataspace'
value (value): the value of the attribute to test. ie. value position'
part (symbol): a symbol part of the address
parent (parent node): name of the parent node. ie. 'parent spat_model'
name (node name):the name of the node. ie. 'name source
instance (instance number): an instance number associated with this node
mode (combination mode): how the filter will combine with other defined filters. Available modes are:
include (default): j.namespace output will include the filter results
exclude: j.namespace output will exclude filter results
restrict: j.namespace output will be restricted to filter results
hamlet: none of the above

method.name: select
method.digest: Select or unselect items in the namespace selection
method.description:
The select message followed by a symbol defining a node address and a boolean value toggle selection on or off. With no boolean value provided, the select message will toggle the address current selection state.
NB: select related messages need the namespace attribute to be defined

method.name: select/all
method.description:
The select/all message toggles selection state on for all nodes in the namespace selection
NB: select related messages need the namespace attribute to be defined

method.name: select/none
method.description:
The select/none message toggles off selection for all nodes in the namespace selection
NB: select related messages need the namespace attribute to be defined

method.name: selection/refresh
method.description:
The selection/refresh message refreshes selection list
NB: select related messages need the namespace attribute to be defined

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: The address attribute sets the root of the nodes addresses the exploration will be performed on. The address may be any node in the namespace, such as the root (/) of the Jamoma namespace (default), a model address or a parameter address for example.

attribute.name: depth
attribute.description: The depth attribute sets the recursive depth used for the exploration. A depth of 1 will perform the exploration only on the first node under the root defined by the address attribute. A depth of -1 (default) will perform the exploration on all nodes under the root.

attribute.name: filter/list
attribute.description:
The filter/list attribute lists the active filters used by j.namespace to select nodes in the namespace. These filters may be filters sent to j.namespace using the filter/set message and corresponding syntaxe or some internally defined filters. These filters are built into j.namespace and allows to filter what their name implicitely refers to:
model
parameter
message
return
view
remote

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: The format attribute defines how results from the exploration filter will be formatted and output

enum.name: none
enum.digest: Results will be output as a list

enum.name: umenu
enum.digest: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a umenu

enum.name: umenu_prefix
enum.digest: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a umenu with root added as prefix

enum.name: jit.cellblock
enum.digest: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a jit.cellblock

enum.name: coll
enum.digest: Results will be itered and formatted to fill a coll

attribute.name: namespace
attribute.description: The namespace attribute sets a name to this instance of j.namespace. This is required when using j.namespace to perform exploration in combination with other Jamoma object such as other instances of j.namespace or j.cue. namespace attribute also activate the selection state feature

attribute.name: output
attribute.digest: Type of nodes to output based on their relationship to the root
attribute.description: The output attribute sets the nodes to output based on their relationship to the exploration root

enum.name: descendants
enum.digest: Ouput all nodes under the root

enum.name: children
enum.digest: Output all nodes direclty descending from root
enum.description: Note that this does not take in account multiple instances of a node.

enum.name: brothers
enum.digest: Output all instances of the exploration root
enum.description: This available only when the exploration root is notthe root of the full namespace of your application (ie. /)

enum.name: attributes
enum.digest: Output all attributes of the exploration root

attribute.name: sort
attribute.digest: Sort result in alphabetical or priority order
attribute.description: The sort attribute gets results from exploration filter sorted alphabetically (default) or based on their priority value

attribute.name: update
attribute.digest: Listen to updates in Jamoma namespace
attribute.description: The update attribute toggles the listening of nodes creation/deletion in Jamoma namespace. When set to off, j.namespace will stop outputing results as changes occur in the namespace. In that case, one must trigger again the namespace exploration to refresh result. (default : 1)
